post.author: UncleWeyland
post.title: Life Pro Tips For Fighting Aging

div.p: Regarding longevity research: I like it, but I might be just a teensy bit biased since that's what I've been interested in for 11 years. I strongly recommend reading The Hallmarks of Aging if you haven't already done so. Some researchers are a bit too adamant about the implications of their work, but competition for funding is fierce in this field (the NIH's NIA has a pretty bad grant payline, unless you're working on neurodegeneration... specifically Alzheimer's) so I understand why some of them might make very strong claims that are understudied in humans.
I don't frequent the subreddit, I read the literature. Want my unsolicited advice for maximizing the chances of reaching escape velocity?

ul.li: Do not get addicted to opioids. (Shocking, I know)
Routinely eat a variety of food to minimize risks of unknown unknowns.
Minimize highly processed foods, bias diet towards vegetables and lean proteins.
Figure out a sleep cycle that works for you and makes you feel rested. Eight hours is not necessary for most people.
Strengthen social bonds. (Even if that research is bunk, having people around to help you if you get in trouble is good.)
Coffee and tea are good. (Bias warning- I like them, so there's inherent incentive for me to want to believe it is good.)
Very occasional intermittent fasting may have benefits and has low risk of harm.
Hormesis: occasionally expose your body to moderate stresses it can handle- hard aerobic activity, heatshock (sauna or thermal spring bath), sun exposure (avoid sunburn though) etc.
Rapamycin (note: this is an immunosuppressant, do not just start supplementing your diet with this)

div.p: Zero Confidence (50/50 these may or may not work):

ul.li: Caloric restriction below maintenance (note: the more complex the organism studied, the less effective this seems to be)

div.p: Mild Negative Confidence (opposed to consensus, >50% chance this is ineffective or even bad):

ul.li: Vegetarian/vegan diet (bias warning- I like eating meat, my opinion is based on evolutionary logic not empirical research)
